II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
6/3/2025 4:00 PM Email Interview
6/2/2025 2:45 PM Email Other
4/8/2025 3:00 PM Email Documentation received or sent
4/2/2025 12:00 PM Onsite Inspection Special Investigation Initiation
III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12504 Eligibility Requirements
Section • (3) An independent living home, staffed and operated by
Description the child placing agency, must be clean, safe, and
appropriate to the needs of the youth it serves.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Facility has bugs and broken refrigerator needs repair.
Investigation I completed an unannounced onsite visit on 04/02/2025. I
conducted a walk-through of the facility and observed some
1

common areas, hallways and three bedrooms. All of the areas
observed were well maintained and appropriate. I observed the
freezer that had been repaired that was in the kitchen area as well
as other refrigerated appliances in the kitchen area. The freezer
was operating properly. Any food/waste in the area was disposed
of properly.
Interviews:
I interviewed Staff 1 and Program Manager at the facility on
04/02/2025. They both stated the freezer had been repaired and
there was no food lost as the food had been transferred to other
refrigerated units when the freezer broke down. Staff 1 and
Program Manager stated there are times when flies and gnats will
gather around food that is left out or uncovered and spoiled food
that is not disposed of properly. Staff 1 and Program Manager
stated the rural location of the facility probably contributes to that
situation.
I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 04/02/2025. Youth A
stated things are going well and did not report any areas of
concern.
I interviewed Youth B at the facility on 04/02/2025. Youth B
stated some flies and gnats had gathered around some spoiled
food a couple of days ago, but otherwise did not report any areas
of concern.
I interviewed Chief Administrator by phone on 04/07/2025.
Chief Administrator stated the freezer had been repaired and the
agency pays for a pest control company to come to the facility
monthly to evaluate and remediate any pest control concerns
identified. I requested the Chief Administrator to submit
documentation related to the freezer repair and pest control
services. This documentation was received 04/08/2025.
I contacted Complainant by email 06/02/2025. Complainant
responded by email 06/03/2025 with no additional concerns other
than what was included in the original complaint. Complainant did
note in the response that the freezer had been repaired.
Documents Reviewed:
I reviewed an Updated Service Plan for Youth B for the time
02/07-05/07/2025. This Updated Service Plan included social
work contacts dated 02/10, 02/17, 02/25, 03/11, 03/25, 04/14, and
04/23/2025. All of these social work contacts included the
observation/statement, "home appears clean, safe, and warm".
2

I reviewed invoices from the pest control company. The invoices
were dated 10/18/2024, 11/18/2024, 12/02/2024, 01/06/2025,
02/03/2025, and 03/03/2025 to confirm monthly pest control
services.
A summary of the documentation related to the freezer repair is as
follows:
Timeline for the Fridge Repair:
02/13/25: Work order began (opened).
02/28/25: Repair company onsite to look at the Fridge (air
compressor on Freezer was bad).
03/12/25: $830 repair cost was approved by supervisor.
03/31/25: Fridge/Freezer was fixed.
04/02/25: Received invoice.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews and documents reviewed the agency adequately
addressed and repaired the freezer as well as pest control.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.

sir_summary.summary: A special investigation was conducted based on allegations of bugs and a broken refrigerator at Holy Cross Children's Services – Mid-Michigan. The investigation found the freezer had been promptly repaired, pest control was regularly serviced, and the facility was maintained appropriately, with no violations established. The investigation concluded the facility was in full compliance with licensing requirements, and the allegations were not substantiated.
